title: ICG, ATS detain boat carrying 8 Pakistanis, 30kg heroin near Gujarat coast

title: Gujarat hospital refuses to hand over Covid patient's body over pending dues, seizes kin's car

title: COVID-19: Gujarat colleges closed till April 30, as state records spike in Coronavirus cases
description: Colleges in Gujarat on Sunday were directed to remain shut till April 30 amid a sharp rise in COVID-19 cases in the state, officials said.

title: COVID-19: More than 2 lakh 20 thousand persons vaccinated in Gujarat
description: In Gujarat, 2 lakh 20 thousand 994 persons were vaccinated yesterday. Total 91 lakh 23 thousand 733 persons have been vaccinated in the state till now.

title: Gujarat: Night curfew extended to rural parts of Surat amid Covid-19 spike
description: In a notification issued, Surat Collector Dhaval Patel extended the curfew to rural parts of the district from Sunday till 31 April.The curfew will remain in place from 8 pm to 6 am, according to the notification

title: Gujarat's Somnath temple closed for 'darshan' amid COVID-19 surge
description: In view of a surge in the COVID-19 infections, the Somnath Temple trust has announced that the temple will remain shut for devotees from April 11 for an indefinite period.

title: Watch: Gujarat’s Vadodara administration punishes COVID protocol violators in unique way
description: Gujarat’s Vadodara administration has made a unique punishment for the people who violate COVID norms. If a person found violating the norms, administration clapped for them and garlanded them. Gujarat has reported over 4,500 cases on April 10.

title: Coronavirus HIGHLIGHTS: Govt Prohibits Exports Of Remdesivir Till Covid-19 Situation Improves In India
description: Coronavirus Cases Live Updates: Amid the worrying spike in Coronavirus cases, Gujarat on Saturday recorded its highest single-day tally of Covid-19 infections so far at 5,011, taking its overall caseload to 3,42,026. Meanwhile, Maharashtra's Covid-19 tally crossed the 33-lakh mark with 55,411 new Covid cases on Saturday.

title: Civic Body Polls In Gujarat's Gandhinagar Postponed Over COVID-19
description: The Gujarat State Election Commission (SEC) on Saturday decided to postpone the elections to the Gandhinagar Municipal Corporation, scheduled to be held on April 18, due to the rise in COVID-19 cases, an official statement said.

title: COVID-19: Gujarat gets 15 lakh new vaccine doses
description: Ahmedabad, Apr 8 (PTI) Amid complaints of a shortage of the COVID-19 vaccine in some parts of Gujarat, the state government on Thursday said it has received 15 lakh new doses from the Centre.

title: COVID-19: Gujarat-based Supreme Industries gets nod for human trials of inhalation therapy
description: The therapy, called LifeViroTreat, has been developed in collaboration with Hyderabad-based Lifeactivers. Timsy Jaipuria reports that this is a 3-day inhalation therapy and the company claims that it can completely kill the COVID-19 virus from the respiratory tract.Get latest Business online at cnbctv18.com

title: Gujarat government refutes Congress' Covid-19 pandemic mismanagement claims
description: Gujarat Deputy Chief Minister Nitin Patel, who handles Health portfolio, said over 80 lakh persons in the state were already given the Covid-19 vaccine, which is a record in the country.

title: Gujarat, Maharashtra, Delhi: List of states with new COVID-19 rules
description: The Gujarat government on Tuesday announced a curfew from 8 pm to 6 am in 20 cities, from April 7 to April 30, 2021. The curfew has been announced in light of rising COVID-19 cases in the state. The cities where the curfew is imposed include Ahmedabad, Surat, Vadodara, Rajkot, Jamnagar, Bhavnagar, Junagadh, Gandhinagar, Anand, Nadiad, Mehasana, Morbi, Dahod, Patan, Godhra, Bhuj, Gandhidham, Bharuch, Surendranagar and Amreli. The state government has reduced the number of people allowed to attend wedding ceremonies to 100 from 200.

title: Gujarat: Night curfew in 20 cities as Covid-19 cases rise
description: The decision to impose the night curfew was taken in the meeting of a core group for coronavirus headed by Gujarat Chief Minister Vijay Rupani
